channel.title: Swine Flu(H1N1) Vaccination = Waste?
channel.description:
Well, the U.S. just wasted another 190$ million in my opinion. They put money into researching a swine flu vaccination, when it's really no worse than the regular flu..
Waste or helpful?

item.title: Swine Flu(H1N1) Vaccination = Waste?
item.dc:creator: @SonGoku SonGoku
item.description:
@SonGoku wrote:

[quote=“Chassy13, post:1, topic:282795”]Well, the U.S. just wasted another 190$ million in my opinion. They put money into researching a swine flu vaccination, when it’s really no worse than the regular flu…

Waste or helpful?[/quote]

Actually statistics show it is a bit worse.
The werid thing about the swine flu is that it’s affecting young, fairly healthy people, and staying away from the older people.

Read full topic

item.title: Swine Flu(H1N1) Vaccination = Waste?
item.dc:creator: @Thebeanie TheBeanie
item.description:
@Thebeanie wrote:

[quote=“inertia, post:51, topic:282795”][quote author=TheBeanie link=topic=373692.msg2885810#msg2885810 date=1248598292]

I Actually had Swine flu last week. Diagnosed by a doctor… Most people have it mild and is like a cold. IE: Cough, Headache, sore throat, Aching. Which is how i had it.

Its really not that bad. I just took 2 painkillers when i woke up everymorning so i only felt shit for about 40 minutes… At least im immune from it now until it mutates lol.

And you will have alot more resistance to the mutated form than people who haven’t had it. I kinda want it, so I can run around crowded areas sneezing on people.

i got it of my mate who had it alot worse then me. His face went grey and his lips swelled up lol… Ended up in hospital for it.
[/quote]

You sure he didn’t go #dba392 as symptoms progressed?[/quote]

What? Speak english on here foo

Read full topic

11. a computer-generated image that is not made by Server-Unknown.Net.[/quote]
Stay on-topic, this is about swine flu, not you having to search up every word in the dictionary to understand what we talk about, and they were right when they said you’re a moron. Swine flu wouldn’t kill them or anything, and they won’t get it just because you’re mad.

Yeah, that’s a waste/ WASTE.

item.title: Swine Flu(H1N1) Vaccination = Waste?
item.dc:creator: @dragonfire455 dragonfire455
item.description:
@dragonfire455 wrote:

[quote=“Server-Unknown.Net, post:47, topic:282795”][quote author=R.I.P RSC link=topic=373692.msg2887817#msg2887817 date=1248720615]

I posted a logo in the graphics section and it got locked with no reason, I asked over 9 times now and no response yet they say im a moron… The idiots dont even know what art is, they consider 3D shit graphics and signatures graphic, but not a logo… I sure would be happiest if all the idiots got the swine flu though.
[center] cry more[/center]

A logo isn’t art either. Art is something that makes you think, a logo is just something that you look at for a few seconds and hopefully you remember it the rest of your life.
[/quote]

Dude, everything around you is art, everything you do involves art, art is what makes creativity better each moment that passes buy.

Ok, let me get on topic though, you talking about art when you don’t even know what your talking about yourself. I just sent Mopman proof that my logo (a graphic, not “art”) is graphics. Graphics are anything that is generated by a computer as a image, and my logo was a image on the computer so for further proof here’s a website so you don’t come back talking about the wrong thing again:

http://dictionary.reference.com/browse/graphics <— best dictionary site bud
11. a computer-generated image.[/quote]You’re telling us to look at a dictionary when you can’t even spell “by” right.

Read full topic

item.title: Swine Flu(H1N1) Vaccination = Waste?
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

[quote=“Tico, post:36, topic:282795”][quote author=goatee link=topic=373692.msg2885354#msg2885354 date=1248565869]

I don’t see why a country would waste such a large amount of money for something that only a few thousand people have died from. Of course if it continues growing at an alarming rate there might be a need for it, but not now.

You just explained why; it’s called preparation. When there’s an if, you need a but. (I made that up but w/e.)
[/quote]

True, however what if it doesn’t spread all that much more? There’s the possibility of anything, and at this stage, without allowing the disease to settle for a few months, they could’ve very well spent $192 million for something that is going to die off in a couple of months.[/quote]
$192 million is not much, if 50000 dies of it and could be saved that cost the government much in lost tax money. If in 1/3 of US get sick of it that can be the reality much of US will stop for a time and cause big problems. If we says they just get sick in one week, even that will cost lots of money.

Read full topic
